website_summaries.verdict: True to its name, this solid gripper has rugged aluminum handles that won't break down like plastic or foam models.
pros: Knurled, aluminum handles are non-slip and don't rip like foam

customer_reviews.title: Not 150 pounds
customer_reviews.text: Felt easier than the 90 pound one I own so I decided to strap it to my luggage scale and pull it till the metal touched it came out at 56 pounds also tested my 90 pound one and it came out to 88 so this product definitely doesn't live up to the number stamped on it I bought this to help me improve my deadlift grip this product feels good in my hand I just wish it was at least close to the 150 pounds it claims
customer_reviews.author: D P

customer_reviews.title: No way its 150 lbs
customer_reviews.text: I have a 90 lb handgrip which is harder than this supposed 150 lb one. This is not worth my time -and it says I am unable to return it, even though I just received it? update: Seller at least gave me a full refund after contacting them. Not sure if I will try another one or go to another brand. So I bought a second one, except at 300 lbs. One side says 300, the other says 350. Essentially, these things are just jank. You won't know what you are getting really.
customer_reviews.author: thatoneguy

customer_reviews.title: A good goal to reach. Helps with weight lifting
customer_reviews.text: Probably will have to work up to these. It took me a few months to get there starting with the 100lbs then quickly moved to the 150lbs then after about a month went to the 200lbs and another 2 months to the 250lbs I can get 2 sets in with the 200lbs then one set in with the 250lbs. I strive to do 10 reps spring up, switch hands same thing, then 10 reps spring down and switch hands same thing. This counts as one set. I've noticed definite increase in grip strength when grappeling and with weight lifting. Pull ups are no longer a struggle staying on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D.

customer_reviews.title: Popeye arms!
customer_reviews.text: I originally got a pair of grips that have a 10-132lbs range not knowing where my grip strength is, I workout everyday in my home gym. The 132lbs was not hard for me, as I'm a bulk-builder so 4 sets of 10 isnt my intention. I got the 300lbs grips, something I can work on for a long time. I can barely squeeze the 300s which is excellent! I've only had them for 2 days now but so far so good. I'll update this if anything fails soon.
customer_reviews.author: J.Cook

customer_reviews.title: Well Built Durable Hand Grip
customer_reviews.text: Well built, durable product. I bought these because I have really used my hands in a long time and thought they would help strengthen up my hands when doing small house projects. I used them only a few times and didn't feel like it helped me that much. I found that actually doing small projects like turning a screw driver tightening hard screws worked much better to strengthening my grip. It is a well built product and probably would build strength if I had used it more often.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Link

customer_reviews.title: exceptional quality
customer_reviews.text: purchased this item to replace my old one/same exact one(had it for 16yrs and going strong), which was left behind by accident overseas, this thing is indestructible and will last a lifetime. worth every penny and will give you Popeye forearms if you train them everyday with this thing. highly recommended for this effective training tool.
customer_reviews.author: VERY HAPPY!

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-duty mothers right here!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever wanted to crush an Apple with your hands, or maybe just your bosses face, this will give you the grip strength to do it! You've got to get some of these! These aren't the sissy ones you get at Walgreen's...these suckers are built to last. Handles are made of steel with a good grip on them. I keep them at my desk at work to squeeze out a few reps after someone ticks me off. Everyone that sees them asks to give them a try. This was the third pair I've bought. I also own the next two levels up. GET EM!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Excerciser
customer_reviews.text: Needed a device to strengthen my grip. Found this hand exerciser. Ordered it - also ordered one for a friend. She was delighted. I keep mine in my truck and use it daily driving down the street. Has increased strength in my grip dramatically. As it has for my friend.
customer_reviews.author: chrisrosprim

customer_reviews.title: Not quite 100 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: I also have the 100lb version from Captains of Crunch and the difference in terms of actual resistance is obvious. This product takes noticeable less hand strength. I would speculate that it's closer to 90lbs. Outside of this, it is superb quality with a lifetime warranty. It feels less abrasive and comfortable than the Captains of Crunch one.
customer_reviews.author: tejanoman

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: This set of grips are the real ones out in the market. For years I've had one type or other. I've had to replace them for one reason or other. Two of them happened to break. Granted, I had them for a long time. However, these heavy duty grips, in my view, will last you for many, many , many more years than the other ones I've experienced. I will have to oder a lower pounds or pressure set of grips cause these should not be underestimated. They are not your regular set of grips. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: lui

customer_reviews.title: Not for the weak
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard took me a month to squeeze fully but great price
customer_reviews.author: Arlington

customer_reviews.title: Nice gripper
customer_reviews.text: Was very pleased with the quality and resistance of this gripper. These grippers are priced less than the captain of crush grippers, and in my opinion are a better gripper. I like the knurling on the captains of crush better I just think they made it too wide.
customer_reviews.author: riversandstreams

customer_reviews.title: and they work great. I went from being able to close the ...
customer_reviews.text: I havent gotten them rated, but I dont see a huge difference between these and Captains of Crush. I have the whole set, and they work great. I went from being able to close the 150lbs a few times to being able to close the 250lbs consistently and the 300lbs for 1 rep every once in awhile. I would recommend picking up Jedd Johnsons book about grip training if youre interested in making progress with grippers.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: A very neglected exercise
customer_reviews.text: I've been for some time using your typical grips, eventually becoming too easy & searched for a stronger type. I did not know these types of grips existed or similar. Been using the HG 250 lb since I received them, certainly tougher in the beginning & though easier presently, I have a ways to even decide about getting rid of these anytime soon. Very please how they’re made & for the most part, I used thinned workout gloves, sometimes just using my bare hands. Although I rather avoid calluses or sore/tenderness, it’s wise to use (leather?) gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy May Becerra

customer_reviews.title: Met Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The Hand Exerciser was what I expected. At 350 lbs it is not something easily compressed. It does offer a work out even by just compressing it (or attempting to) just a small amount.
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t wait to get on this level. It’s like squeezing a brick. I own the 150 and 200. I can do the 150 easy. 200 I do sets of ten while on the computer and I just purchased the 250 and 300. I can do the 250 once. 300 is an office contest currently. Great desk items for the office to play with!
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but has design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sturdy and well built. These will last awhile and won't be easily damaged. Cons: Unfortunately there are some design flaws. The opposing grips are offset too much which causes it to be awkward in your hand when you squeeze them. This might not be a problem if the grips had more "grip". That is the 2nd problem...the knurled grips are poorly done. The knurls are flat and slick and provide minimal benefit. 100# is not as hard as I expected. You should probably go up in resistance if you want to use it for strength building.
customer_reviews.author: BSXX

customer_reviews.title: This HEAVY GRIP 250 is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing, I'm a Colombian Armwrestler, I find it great and I am very satisfied with this purchase. The materials to the touch are perceived to be of very good quality, their durability is good, easy to carry, easy to clean, both the spring and the grips are excellent. Ideal for people who have already had experience with lower resistance grips or training where the grip of the hands is very involved. Very good tool to strengthen fingers and forearms.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Sánchez Montaña

customer_reviews.title: good for small hands, too
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy hand grippers that had metal handles, because the ones with plastic foam handles (per the reviews) smell like chemicals. Because I am a short female, with proportionately small hands, I was afraid that these grips would be too big. However, the size is not a problem. As a plus, they are well made and the ridges in the metal make the handles easy to grip. If you are male, however, you may want a higher-weight grip; my tall husband found the 100 lb. version too easy to use, even the first time he tried it.
customer_reviews.author: kareninca

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the 150 and 200 for a number of years and they work great and have held up well. I bought the 100 because I am recovering from surgery on my right arm and hand and the 150 was just a little too much resistance. The 100 is right where I expected it would be relative to the 150 and seems to be the same high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ned L

customer_reviews.title: Best grips around
customer_reviews.text: I had a full set of these about 8 years ago and loved them. One of them got stolen and i got a replacement for it. Still loving the quality and how well it holds up. Great for armwrestlers looking to get a better grip!
customer_reviews.author: Evilzombie

customer_reviews.title: Well built for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for these after a co woker had The 250 lb one at the office- and I realized I'm not as strong as I remember. The 150 offers a good workout for me, and it is not so expensive I can buy the 250 if this one becomes too easy.
customer_reviews.author: S-417

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Knockoff from CoC ones
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 150lbs one in hopes of improving grip strength. I started with the 88lbs one that is sold all over amazon just rebranded. After using that guy for over a year, I am confident to move onto the next step. Figured I'd go with the Amazon recommended one. I was met with huge disappointment. This gripper is easier than the 88lb one. Heck, I let a couple of my coworkers try and they said it wasn't easy but it wasn't hard either. Honestly, I'd be fine with a replacement if it was possible. If not, refund and I'll get the CoC ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey J

customer_reviews.title: Test your might
customer_reviews.text: This is a step up from the 150. But the construction is great very clean looking gripper I look to master in a couple months
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: It was a good starting point for me and I continue to use ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the first gripper that I purchased with any real resistance. It was a good starting point for me and I continue to use it for warming up and higher reps. Although it is a good product and I do not regret making the purchase, Heavy Grips can not compare with the overall quality of the Captains of Crush grippers. My suggestion would be to start off with a Captains of Crush #1 and work your way up.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of material
customer_reviews.text: Got ahead of myself bought the 350 pounds thinking it wouldn't match up to what is said but def is cant even squeeze a bit, thinking of buying the full set and slowly graduate because honestly it is what it advertises
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: not captain's of crush
customer_reviews.text: It's not captain's of crush. It is however fine as a stress relief in the car or wherever. The gripper is better than others at it's price point. If you can afford better get the better
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Leisure

customer_reviews.title: Its tougher than you know
customer_reviews.text: Way tougher than I expected. Grip is shotty. I have big hands and a good grip, lighter is the key. I did go full boar though. Grips= not enought
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: Came Quickly and Just What We Ordered
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these grips constantly at different levels. He is now at 350. Improves his grip for weightlifting and baseball. He has such a strong grip now.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Great, high quality
customer_reviews.text: If you can pinch these things closed all the way, you're in decent shape. Don't underestimate these things. I'm in okay shape and have a pretty strong grip, but I can't even close these things all the way. Pleasantly surprised. Also love the rough handle. Plastic handles can dig into your hands after a while and get really uncomfortable quickly, but no worries there with these. Haven't tried Captains of Crush but this is definitely good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Will D

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: Have had for a week and have survived thorough use from my friends coworkers and myself. I started with the 200 lb version and they are unclosable for most people. Two others and myself have been able to close them. I have just ordered the 250lb today.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Much harder than I thought it'd be.. Got the 250lbs and can do those... Only half way on these... Quality build.
customer_reviews.author: MattsViews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Piece of Machinery
customer_reviews.text: Hi guys. Wow. Ok Ill post my thoughts on here. Honestly I love these lil monsters. I have a pretty decent grip so I started with the 200 pounders. I do sets of 3 at 20 to start. Do the normal grips then turn them over upside down to 3 and 20 again and then open hand grip them to build the muscles in my fingers and thumb. I actually love this product. I am going to purchase the 300 lbers in a week or so. Great product and I love the lb markings that help you keep your self in check.
customer_reviews.author: Redfeather Blackwolf

customer_reviews.title: Best grips out there!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many types of hand grips in the past and found that these are the most indestructible out there. The tension is consistent and the grip width is wide enough to give you a full range of motion for your hand. There may be more expensive ones out there but they are not any better than these. I've got the 150's, and up. I recommend you start with the 150's (beginners and intermediates). Can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: BigDan

customer_reviews.title: My son was happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My youngest son wanted so we got it and hes happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaof5

customer_reviews.title: 150lbs is right for me!
customer_reviews.text: I did some researches before purchase and I am glad I have done it. Normally an adult male can grip 100lbs and since I have been on weight training for a year I guessed 150lbs works fine. It turns out to work like a charm, I can feel my hands are getting a good exercise while it's managable. My colleagues who don't exercise could barely squeeze it a bit though. The quality is good and I believe it will last for a decade or more.
customer_reviews.author: keye

customer_reviews.title: You better be strong....
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fairly strong man and I am able to completely close these repeatedly with one hand, however they are pretty tough to squeeze shut. Also, the handles can be a little uncomfortable because they are textured metal. It would be more comfortable if they had plastic or some other durable material that's softer than metal. If I were to buy again, I think I'd choose something lower than 150lbs.
customer_reviews.author: lunchroom

customer_reviews.title: ... hand and 150 right hand and was bragging how easy his current grip trainer was
customer_reviews.text: My son's grip is about 170 Left hand and 150 right hand and was bragging how easy his current grip trainer was. So... I had to get this one. Comical how much resistance there is.
customer_reviews.author: M. Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amount of tension
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the 250 Lb gripper. I work out a decent amount and I guess I thought I was stronger than I am. I was able to close it one time (touching end to end) after a few weeks of using it. However, not consistently and it felt like a little too much for a good workout. So I downgraded to the 200 and I can click this one 8-10. Ill typically do another 8 or so as far as I can and get a great burn. Hopefully with more training I can transition at some point up to the 250!
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: I have the 100 lb version and was stepping up ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the 100 lb version and was stepping up to the 150 lb version. I ordered no less than 3 of these to get one matching the quality of the first pair of 100's. All 3 150's had quality issues (first 2 arrived already opened and appeared to be "fixed" since there was visible glue at the top). Decided to break down and get CoC grippers, as they seem to be more consistent and reliable in the manufacturing process. Its a shame because I have no issues with functionality and finish of the 100's. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: T. F.

customer_reviews.title: Handles are not steel anymore, feels like hollow aluminum
customer_reviews.text: These newer models are very hollow, my older one's where heavy. I guess like everything else there going cheap with material but it will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: D ANTHONY

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow workout!
customer_reviews.text: Work like I expected them too. Great knurling. I'm 65 & fit - former strongman. The 150 gave ma some challenge. I will most likely purchase the other ones. My only wish is, tht they had a greater handle circumference (thicker handles.)
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't wear out like the cheapo rubber harbinger ones. Definitely helped me train to get the necessary grip strength to pull 405 lbs about 3 years back. I still have this gripper and it is still in great working condition!
customer_reviews.author: Buck Scraper

customer_reviews.title: Honest first impressions
customer_reviews.text: Great hand grip to work on your grip, later this year and I’m buying the last one at 300lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality, quiet, Super Heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to strengthen my grip, FYI 150Ibs. Is HEAVY! I can usually get 9 reps on right hand and 7 reps on left hand. If I was going to reorder, I would order 100Ibs and work up to 150. High quality, doesn't squeek, and I will never order another brand besides this one.
customer_reviews.author: Zac J.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Grips 100
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my son, 15 yrs old. This is the "100" model, and turned out to be perfect for him. He is not a big guy, but has been working out, and the cheap grips from the big box stores just were not cutting it. The grips are a bit rough and take some adjusting to, so be prepared for that. Overall quality is very good, and we may get the heavier model soon.
customer_reviews.author: John Goodin

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because after my brain surgery, for some strange reason, my left forearm was amazingly weak. I bought this to strengthen my left forearm mainly. I had to tape up the handles cause they were rough to me, but other than that, I love this thing. I'm slowly going up in weight on this. I used to have to 100lb version, now I'm on 150lbs. I use the grips twice a week, & no problems here.
customer_reviews.author: ramon2585

customer_reviews.title: Sent the wrong one
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 150 a 200 and a 250 but got 2 200’s and no 150 but it made a good gift so I will order another one
customer_reviews.author: Ulysses Levy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, I use it everyday
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, I use it everyday. Only problem is the cross-hatching makes on the handles are quite deep and a little rough. It would be better if they were smoother, but that would not stop me from purchasing. I bought a second one so I keep one at home and one in the office, at my computer, and while I sit at my desk, improve hand and wrist strength.
customer_reviews.author: J. Samuelson

customer_reviews.title: No creaking sound!
customer_reviews.text: If you are choosing between these and COC, definitely buy these. They are almost half the price with no difference at all. On the contrary, I have seen many COC's making a creaking sound but heavy grips are absolutely silent. Love them. I got the 200lb.
customer_reviews.author: dhruvshekhawat

customer_reviews.title: Great for advanced grip training
customer_reviews.text: I have the 250lb gripper and I’ve been working with it for about 2 months now and I’m very pleased with it. The gripper has held up to a lot of heavy use and maintained the strength of its spring. It is very well constructed and I’m impressed with the level of quality it provides for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Davis

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 28 year old 165lb male. I'm an electrician by trade. The 150LBer is perfect for me. I can close it about 7-10 times for the first few sets, then 4-6 for about 10 more sets. Many reviews mention the rough grips, they are not rough for me, but if you type all day, it may hurt your hands. Quality product that I look forward to using.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Good overall but after a few days started making squaking noise which is a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Griips for good hand exercise.
customer_reviews.text: The 150 is a good addition the 200/250/300 I already had. I really only use the 150 and 200. The 250 are very stiff and the 300is like a brick so far. As others have noted the texture takes a little getting use to.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This item was a counterfeit according to the Heavy Grip Company which I contacted. This item broke after less than 3 months of usage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just pulled it out of the box and the handle ...
customer_reviews.text: Just pulled it out of the box and the handle came off the metal the first time I squeezed it. Nowhere does it say that this is supposed to happen in the description. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: PSJJSFam

customer_reviews.title: Nice grips
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. I assume the 200lbs is accurate. They will cause calluses for sure as they are pretty rough.Very solid. Only have had them for a week but they are working. I am 6' 195lbs and work out but hadn't been working out my "hands" and I could do a couple with my right hand and barely 1 with my left hand on first day. Already improved to 5 and 3 after 1 week.
customer_reviews.author: Smitay

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No complaints. New addition to my desk for doinking around instead of working.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: It's a good starter strength level for someone who has above average ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works quite well and came just as advertised. The tension spring is strong and the handles contract and expand quite smoothly. It's a good starter strength level for someone who has above average grip/forearm strength and will be challenging for a while. The only real drawback I could mention is that the texture of the handles is a little uncomfortable- but no so much that it's a problem; just something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That turned out to be a good thing as these are tough on the hands
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 150, received a 100 instead. That turned out to be a good thing as these are tough on the hands. I have blisters all over my fingers, I could only do it a few times at first, yesterday I managed to do 5 sets of 10 reps and more. My forearms are literally rock hard now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good to go
customer_reviews.text: I’m a well built guy, super active and fit and I assumed these would be junk so ordered the 350lb one, I can assure you they’re not junk, I can get it to binge and maybe get 1/3 of a full contraction but Defiently to big for me, gonna buy some 250’s and try those
customer_reviews.author: Karyn Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Grips are good, for anyone starting out I recommend starting out with the 100 or 150
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Ahuatzi

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails but best suited for weak - average grip.
customer_reviews.text: The gripper is well built and solid. The texture is a little rough but not harsh at all, however I don't think this is a deal breaker in any way as it prevents slipping and you can always use a cloth over the handles if it is too rough for you. I work out fairly often but my grip has always been weak. I expected the 150lbs to be a challenge but it wasn't as tough as I expected. I think the 200lbs might be the better option if you're accustomed to weight lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Travis khan

customer_reviews.title: Said it works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this is a gift for my brother-in-law and he loves it! He's competes as an arm wrestler and uses this to train. Said it works great!
customer_reviews.author: MehMor

customer_reviews.title: must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Came in on time. Trust me when I say this......its lives up to its name "HEAVY GRIPS". YOU will feel this! Easy to fit in your pocket and it's light. If you're looking for gains to light reps three sets.
customer_reviews.author: Domenique Wickham

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Grip Strengthening Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a top notch quality product that will definitely not fall apart. It is well worth the extra money compared to the cheaper grip strengtheners. I started with the 150 lbs product and will probably be using it for a while as it is definitely not easy to close all the way.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Grip training beyond the plastic handled devices.
customer_reviews.text: I love the way the machined gnarled handles feel, although you can count on the formation of calluses.I first purchased the 200, and found it to be too difficult for a full range of motion. I next purchased the 150 and feel this is a resistance I can train with. I would not mind having a set of 100's for warm ups and multiple reps. These are great tools to keep handy in the car for quick forearm workouts.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Strong Grip!
customer_reviews.text: Just what you're looking for! Develops grip and strength in your hands and forearms. After using this for a while I've gotten a little stronger and think I'm going to buy the next size up but it's perfect for price! Built well and is very durable! Because of the price, I would recommend this item for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: BROgle

customer_reviews.title: Great piece, pick it up and use it whenever
customer_reviews.text: Great piece, pick it up and use it whenever, really convenient and well built. Great value for the money, would absolutely recommend for people beginning to develop their grip and forearms. Just squeeze it as far as you can, hold, and release. Rinse repeat for a quick and good grip and forearm workout. Once you can easily touch the bars together, upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Peterson

customer_reviews.title: these do not feel like 150 pounds
customer_reviews.text: As people have said, these do not feel like 150 pounds. I began using a 88lbs adjustable pair, once those got easy I decided to give these a spin. They are definitely more challenging relative to the 88lbs but not by a whole lot. They feel like 110 or so...but what do I know. I would still recommend these. I get blisters fairly easily but fortunately the handles cause no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nurling was discolored like it was hand sweat and the spring was damaged
customer_reviews.text: Was not in proper package, nurling was discolored like it was hand sweat and the spring was damaged. I also bought it new and this was for sure not new
customer_reviews.author: dylan ranzie

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my father in law for a birthday present and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product.  Not that easy!
customer_reviews.text: Quality Product. Got the 100 pound to start. Not extremely difficult. But harder than I thought. Will purchase the 150,200,250 set very soon.
customer_reviews.author: ken hasel

customer_reviews.title: Best hand grippers I have seen
customer_reviews.text: This hand gripper is very well built and looks that way. Unlike cheap hand grippers, the spring of this one doesn't make a lot of noise when you squeeze. Also, the handles are metal, not foam that lasts only a few weeks. I have the 100 and 150 ones and will get the 200 one as well. Happy with my purchases. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M&M&M&M

customer_reviews.title: Best hand grippers I have seen
customer_reviews.text: This hand gripper is very well built and looks that way. Unlike cheap hand grippers, the spring of this one doesn't make a lot of noise when you squeeze. Also, the handles are metal, not foam that lasts only a few weeks. I have the 100 and 150 ones and will get the 200 one as well. Happy with my purchases. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M&M&M&M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I just leave it in the car and use it on my commute
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Dogs

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: While this may say 150lbs, I have my doubts. I'm using the ACF hand grip strengther which is rated for 77lbs and that one is a lot harder than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gozirra

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well, I have a trigger finger,and this helps strength it not only finger but the whole hand
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your ready.
customer_reviews.text: This grip is not to be trifled with it give you the good strong hand feels. You train then crush life out of enemies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: I am a 36 yr old male, 195lbs, active. I ordered this product for use at my office and it has been what I hoped for. Based on reading other reviews, I purchased this and after some use, let me echo other sentiments. Yes, the handles are a bit rough, but I like the texture. The 150lbs resistance is strong and effective enough for me and I'm a fairly strong guy. It will get a little squeaky but add some WD40. I've found the best use is simply to hold the grip compressed as long as possible in addition to regular squeezing. If you're looking for a grip, this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hand Grippers
customer_reviews.text: Received in 2 days as promised and are so easy to use. Feel comfortable in the grip and definitely give a tough workout as they are the intermediate 150 lbs. each grip (bought 2). Very happy as my old ones I was doing 250-400 reps before tiring. These I'm only doing 50 with a struggle so a good workout with room to grow with this set.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Strengthen your hands and kill stress.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Heavy Grip Hand Grippers 100 to exercise my hands as I don't get the manual hand exercise I did when I was younger. The 100 lb. tension is perfect to get started with and you can do it while sitting or standing. My only complaint is the coarse metal handles are a little rough on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Diceman

customer_reviews.title: Okay Product
customer_reviews.text: After a couple weeks of using this product. The product lost its strength. Also, The strength wasn't accurate to the description. I bought the 200lb, but it felt less than the 150lbs that my friend had. It was cheap, but i made good used for it. Its probably 125 0r so, but its great.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ramos

customer_reviews.title: wonderful hand workout
customer_reviews.text: wonderful hand workout. I bought several strengths, this 300 lb one is for beasts so use caution when buying.
customer_reviews.author: Guido

customer_reviews.title: Good grip tool
customer_reviews.text: I liked the quality of the product and how smooth the resistance of the grippers is. They are very comfortable on the hands as well.
customer_reviews.author: kw

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: 150lbs is probably a good starting point for most males that are fairly active.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Your grip will be a WMD soon
customer_reviews.text: Gonna be able to crush a brick with my weak hand in no time son
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Not a brilliant design but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help keep the strength up in my arthritic hands. The metal handles have sharp edged knurling that's not comfortable. It does the job. The price is for one item despite what the pictures suggest.
customer_reviews.author: Wackezoid

customer_reviews.title: Yes, a must buy if your grip for heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, a must buy if your grip for heavy weight and pull up bar is slacking I usually do these three times a day and just go for the squeeze or a pump as I walk to the gym..
customer_reviews.author: Domenique Wickham

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. The varying resistance models helps one to build up strength.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Schartup

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works your hand muscles thoroughly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent exerciser of the hand and to lesser degree, the forearms. Hands have gotten stronger. Great stress reliever, too. Can callus the skin on the inside of your palm, but if you're worried about soft hands, you wouldn't be looking to get this product.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Good grips  not for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Good grips , I suggest if you are a beginner don't get these. You will never squeeze therm. Go for the 100 or 150. This is for someone who has a little experience. These grips will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: hbike1300

customer_reviews.title: This one is hard
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty good gripping strength from lifting, ring workouts and guitar playing. This one will give you a heavy set! If possible, I'd recommend working up a lower resistance - 150 or maybe 200. I couldn't budge the 300.
customer_reviews.author: David Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla proof.
customer_reviews.text: These grips are by far some of the sturdiest I have ever come across. the knurled metal handles give an excellent grip, though they could possible be a bit too rough for some. All in all an excellent buy that should last for darn near forever.
customer_reviews.author: CopOut

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: too loud, needs WD40 before getting to the end customer
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, I consider myself in decent shape though ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, I consider myself in decent shape though much of that is cardio and these provide a nice workout. 150's are obviously tougher but if you are starting out I would go with 100s to start with and build up the muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Frappier

customer_reviews.title: Intermediate Grip
customer_reviews.text: Fairly simple product but it seems pretty well built... starts off a little stiff but then loosens up a bit ..does start squeaking after a while.. like others have said its pretty well labeled as "intermediate"
customer_reviews.author: Random.Person

customer_reviews.title: No returns?
customer_reviews.text: Not what my husband wanted. Tried to return and says “ineligible for return.” I don’t know why. I received this today and it Hasn’t even been opened...
customer_reviews.author: amie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. Grid hurts my hand but I just put some tape on and that helped.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis Kloke

customer_reviews.title: ... able to close the 250 but I can't YET great buy if your trying to get a monster
customer_reviews.text: I workout and I am a construction worker I use my hands all the time and I thought I would be able to close the 250 but I can't YET great buy if your trying to get a monster grip
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Garcia

product_meta.title: Heavy Grips - Hand Grippers for Beginners to Professionals - 100-350 lbs Resistance
feature_bullets: BREAKTHROUGH YOUR PHYSICAL LIMITS – As most athletes know, if you want to improve your overall fitness you MUST train your weakest link. But there’s a difference between knowing this and DOING IT. If you’re looking to take your power lifting or other feats of strength to the next level then this is how you succeed… you TRAIN YOUR GRIP.

DESIGNED TO INCREASE YOUR GRIP STRENGTH – There’s nothing in a typical gym that compares to these hand grippers. Just think about it. Nearly every piece of equipment you touch wasn’t SOLELY created to target and isolate your forearms, fingers, and wrists. Meaning there’s no chance they’ll be as effective as these grip strengtheners.

ON-THE-GO HAND EXERCISES – Unlike most training, you can do these exercises just about anywhere. You can use these while you’re at the office or even in the car if you travel for work. They’re basically a discrete training tool that transforms your job and downtime into productive workout sessions.

CREATE HANDS OF STEEL – Just like in life, you’re going to have to get comfortable with being uncomfortable. We mention this because our grip handles weren’t built for dainty little hands. They were built to toughen you up and that’s how finger exercises should be. Trust us, your hands will get used to it and, afterwards, you’ll be grateful for it.

THE PERFECT PROGRESSION – No matter where you’re starting, and how strong you want to get, there’s always room to grow. That’s why our grippers increase at 50 lbs increments: to help you stay physically challenged. Thus, if all 6 grippers seem like too much then just start with the first 3 weights (100lbs, 150lbs, 200lbs). Whatever your needs, we’ve got you covered
